00174  cr_id_t cr_get_id(void (*pFunc)(void))
00175 {
00176     int32_t i;
00177     cr_id_t id = CR_INVALID_ID;
00178 
00179     for(i = 0;i <= cr_g_thread_cnt; i++)
00180     {
00181         if(cr_g_context[i].pFunc == pFunc)
00182         {
00183             id = i;
00184 
00185             break;
00186         }
00187     }
00188 
00189 //    printf("cr_get_id pFunc: 0x%X\n", pFunc);
00190 //    printf("cr_get_id id: %d\n", id);
00191 
00192     return id;
00193 }

00199 void cr_reset(void)
00200 {
00201     cr_g_context        = 0;
00202     cr_g_context_cnt    = 0;
00203     cr_g_thread_cnt     = 0;
00204     cr_g_previous_cr_id = CR_INVALID_ID;
00205     cr_g_current_cr_id  = CR_INVALID_ID;
00206     cr_g_activate_id    = CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID;
00207     cr_g_sys_started    = false;
00208 }

00219 void cr_init(CR_CONTEXT*    cr_context,
00220              size_t         cr_context_count)
00221 {
00222     // Init the array of CR_CONTEXT structs as well as the globals.
00223     assert(cr_context && "user param cr_context must be non-zero!\n");
00224     assert((cr_context_count > 0) && "user param cr_context_count must be non-zero!\n");
00225 
00226     memset(cr_context, 0, cr_context_count * sizeof(CR_CONTEXT));
00227 
00228     cr_g_context        = cr_context;
00229     cr_g_context_cnt    = cr_context_count;
00230 }
00231 
00241 void cr_idle(void)
00242 {
00243     // This needs to be static because the function (initially) returns normally.
00244     // It does work (on my system with my compiler) when it's not static but
00245     // I'm not sure why, nevertheless, static is correct.
00246     static cr_id_t volatile temp_id;
00247 
00248     // Set some of the idle thread's context information.
00249     cr_g_context[CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID].pFunc = cr_idle;
00250     cr_g_context[CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID].id    = CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID;
00251 
00252     // Init the idle thread's context and return, this function is now a coroutine.
00253     if(!setjmp(cr_g_context[CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID].env))
00254         return;
00255 
00256     // This will be the entry point when longjump is called with cr_idle's context.
00257     // No need to perform another setjmp from within the loop; not much happening.
00258     for(;;)
00259     {
00260         // Spin until a non-idle thread is activated.
00261         if(cr_g_activate_id == CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID)
00262             continue;
00263 
00264         assert((cr_g_activate_id <= cr_g_context_cnt) && "cr_idle: cr_g_activate_id out of bounds!\n");
00265 
00266         // Save the activated coroutine ID and reset the global variable.
00267         temp_id             = cr_g_activate_id;
00268         cr_g_activate_id    = CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID;
00269 
00270         // Goto the activated coroutine.
00271         longjmp(cr_g_context[temp_id].env, 1);
00272     }
00273 }
00274 
00289 cr_id_t cr_register_thread(void (*pFunc)(void))
00290 {
00291     assert(pFunc && "cr_register_thread: pFunc is invalid!\n");
00292 
00293     // Increase the coroutine count.
00294     cr_g_thread_cnt += 1;
00295 
00296     // Include the cr_idle coroutine in the assert check.
00297     assert(((cr_g_thread_cnt + 1) <= cr_g_context_cnt) && "cr_register_thread: [(cr_g_thread_cnt + 2) <= cr_g_context_cnt] failed\n");
00298 
00299     // Assign the coroutine's ID and function pointer to its context structure
00300     cr_g_context[cr_g_thread_cnt].id    = cr_g_thread_cnt;
00301     cr_g_context[cr_g_thread_cnt].pFunc = pFunc;
00302 
00303     // cr_g_current_cr_id is used by the CR_THREAD_INIT macro to identify
00304     // the coroutine.
00305     cr_g_current_cr_id = cr_g_thread_cnt;
00306 
00307     // We temporarily use the idle thread's CR_CONTEXT structure element
00308     // for the setjmp, the function being called uses the saved context in a
00309     // longjmp call back here; we _don't_ want the registered function to return
00310     // normally, otherwise any automatic variables that the user declared
00311     // would be invalid.
00312     if(!setjmp(cr_g_context[CR_REGISTER_THREAD_ID].env))
00313         pFunc();
00314 
00315     // The function is now a coroutine.
00316     // This is where we return from CR_THREAD_INIT via the longjump.
00317 
00318     // A sentinal. At init the coroutine returned via a longjump so the return
00319     // point saved in the function's prolog is valid and will return here
00320     // should the coroutine actually return normally via the epilog code.
00321     if(cr_g_sys_started == CR_SYSTEM_STARTED)
00322     {
00323         // What to do?
00324         // - nothing and return normally
00325         // - yield to whatever is in cr_g_previous_cr_id
00326         // - yield to cr_idle
00327         // - assert
00328         // - exit
00329 
00330         // Note, cr_g_current_cr_id holds the ID of the exiting coroutine.
00331         // Note, cr_g_previous_cr_id holds the ID of the previous coroutine.
00332 
00333         // Note, it's not possible to remove the exiting coroutine from the
00334         // context array because the remaining coroutine ID's cannot be changed,
00335         // a coroutine's ID is the index into the context array.
00336 
00337         // Look at the cr_g_current_cr_id variable in a debugger to see the ID
00338         // of the exiting coroutine.
00339         assert(CR_ERROR_CR_EXITING && "cr_register_thread: coruotine exiting!\n");
00340 
00341         // Pass EXIT_SUCCESS; we want any user registered clean-up
00342         // function to be called.
00343         exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00344     }
00345 
00346     return cr_g_thread_cnt;
00347 }
